dxf2svg.util.wiretrace
Class FindApplyWireIDsStrategy

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.util.wiretrace.WireSearchStrategy
      dxf2svg.util.wiretrace.FindApplyWireIDsStrategy
public class FindApplyWireIDsStrategy
extends WireSearchStrategy

This algorithm seeks the first text from the opposite end of the 'SHEET n[n]' pattern and gives the wire that the text appears over, that wire number as an ID attribute.

This is strictly for Spar formatted wiring diagrams.

NOTES: The algorithm works like this:

  1. If the drawing starts with a 'w' or 'W' only proceed. (see DxfConverter for code location.)
  2. Search the 't' layer for all text that matches the CrossSheetWireIDs.wirePattern regex.
  3. Search the 'english' layer for all references to 'SHEET [n]'.
  4. Find all the polylines on the 'gang' layer that are close to the previous search results. These polylines have intersection points numbered from 0 to n -1.
  5. Take each of the found wire identification numbers with the smallest virtual reference frame, and test each polyline wire to see if the 1 to n-1 intersections fall inside the frame. If not test the 0th intersection. If matched, make entry in log, add the text as an ID attribute to the wire.
  6. If the previous test fails search all the other wires until successful match is found.
  7. If the text still does not match, extend the reference frame and research the wires useing the previously mentioned steps.
  8. If that fails discard text, make entry in log, take the next wire id number and repeat until the list of wire id numbers is exhausted.

Version:
2.01 - October 4, 2005
Author:
Andrew Nisbet

isTextOnWire

protected boolean isTextOnWire(SvgText svgTextWireId,
                               java.util.Vector wireCollection,
                               boolean searchFirstIntersection,
                               int testPass)
This method takes the test wire id number and tries to match it to any wire but by starting on the second intersection of the wire polyline.

This method is also where the id is added to the wire.

Parameters:
svgTextWireId - The test wire id
wireCollection - The collection of wires to test the wire id against
searchFirstIntersection - flag to initiate search on first intersection of the wire polyline or to start on the second and work back.
testPass - The pass number for setting the relative frame size of the text element.

setWireId

protected void setWireId(SvgText svgTextWireId,
                         WireLabelLocation wireLocation)
This method applies the wire id. It also checks to see if the wire already has a wire id and if it does resolves which is the correct ID.

isWireMatch

protected boolean isWireMatch(WireLabelLocation wireLocation,
                              SvgText svgTextWireId,
                              boolean searchFirstIntersection,
                              int testPass)
This method takes the text and creates a virtual reference frame around the insersion point, it then measures whether any of the intersections of the argument wire falls within this reference frame.

Here is an explaination of intersections: 

   intersection 1
                o-------- Q55A16 --------
                 \
                  \o----- Q55C18 --------
      intersection 2
Q55A16 will match both wires if it appears on the label list before the label Q55C18. To get around this we will test the wires from second intersection first. There will be a successful match for all the secondary wires first, then the primary wire will not match anything because its label is on the first segment. Next we test the first segment and the primary wire will pass.

Parameters:
wireLocation - A SvgDoubleEndedGraphicElement (polyline) that represents a wire.
svgTextWireId - SvgText element.
searchFirstIntersection - True if the search starts at intersection 0 of a polyline and false if all other intersections to be search.
testPass - The pass number of the search from 1 to MAX_SEARCH.
Returns:
true if an intersection falls within the SvgText object's insertion reference frame and false otherwise.

isWireIntersectionInBoundingBox

protected boolean isWireIntersectionInBoundingBox(SvgText text,
                                                  Point pt,
                                                  int testPass)
This method measures whether a vertual bounding box created in relation to the SvgText insertion point, encloses the argument point pt. If it fails, it makes MAX_SEARCH other attempts, each time broadening the width of the bounding box in an attempt to rigorously test if the point will eventually match. This is done because the text can appear at almost any distance from the nearest intersection of a wire.

Parameters:
text - The text reference whose insertion point is used to create the bounding box for testing
pt - A point that may or may not fall within the bounding box.
testPass - Determines the size of the reference frame to attempt to capture a wire's intersection. There are MAX_SEARCH number of passes, each will extend the reference frame a little farther trying to match a polyline's intersection.
Returns:
true if the point is within the bounding box and false otherwise.
